name: Live Like Local
description:
Step away from the city and into the heart of village life at Thagatti Village, nestled in the serene Melagiri Hills. This 2-day, 1-night retreat offers a deeply immersive experience rooted in local stories, traditions, and community living.
Reconnect with the land and embrace the pace of rural life with:
-bamboo basket making workshop
-foraging and cooking session
- permaculture farming walk
- a sunset hike and peaceful stream dips
- a slow-paced village walk guided by Madhan, your local host and naturalist, who brings the culture to life in Hindi, English, Tamil, and Kannada.
Stay in a cozy bamboo hut, savor home-cooked farm meals, and soak in bonus seasonal experiences like a local Kannada play or village festivals, depending on the time of year.
Perfect for those seeking meaningful travel, this retreat prioritizes people over places and stories over itineraries. Limited spots. Fixed menu. Deep connection.
Contact: Vaishnavi- 8796233031

name: Intro to 3D Printing
description:
Discover how 3D printers work, explore the software needed to design 3D models, and watch the magic of 3D printing in action.

✨ What You’ll Do:
-  Learn the basics of 3D printing technology and how it works.
-  Explore the software tools used to create and prepare 3D models.
-  Watch a 3D printer in action as it brings designs to life.
-  Take home a sample print as a keepsake!
-  No prior experience is necessary. Whether you’re curious about 3D printing or looking to get started, this workshop is perfect for you! 

General rules 
-  Ages 14 and above.
-  Please bring your own Laptops (Mac/Windows/Linux is okay)
-  Contact 95132 22681 for any queries

name: Book Discussion : WATER DAYS with Sundar Sarukkai and Srikar Raghavan
description:
A community in tumultuous post-liberalization Bangalore grapples with an influx of northern immigrants and the mysterious death of Archana, a teenager involved with one of the migrants. 

Working with all the means and tools offered to a mature writer, Sundar Sarrukai depicts the overnight springing up of new neighborhoods and ways of living, new jobs, new migrations and growing tensions. We are given a sense of how untrammeled urbanization has turned the local administration rogue and uncaring. All along, men and women line up to collect water and stories in the dead of night. 

Join us to discuss the themes mentioned in this book with Sundar Sarrukai, author and Srikar Raghavan, writer and researcher.
